With his bargain fulfilled, Mephistopheles claimed the woman and dragged her to Hell to suffer her reward, and from her tormented womb slithered free these abominations.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oubliette has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oubliette's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Wailing Soul
entries: The insane head attached to the oubliette's tentacle screeches and wails. Whenever a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the oubliette, the creature must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the {@condition frightened} creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect becomes immune to the oubliette's Wailing Soul for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oubliette makes a slam attack and a bite attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp {@recharge 4}
entries: The oubliette brings down its foot with tremendous force, causing a shock wave to travel through the ground in a 60-foot radius. Each creature on the ground in the area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 8d12}) force damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or taking just half the damage on a successful one.

Found throughout Hell, oubliettes were created by Asmodeus to deny pure souls from reaching the Lords of Good for all time. Big, lumbering things of flabby flesh, they each have long tentacles that extend out from their stomachs and end with the severed heads of good creatures they have stolen from the Material Plane. As they travel through Hell, oubliettes ensure their victims bear witness to the plane's worst atrocities.
A struggle for souls

The planar powers contend with each other for souls. Devils tempt mortals into evil so that their souls will travel to Hell upon death. Likewise, the souls of the good go to the Seven Heavens or other good planes. Accumulating souls makes both gods and devils more powerful, which is why the war is prosecuted with such vigor. Each corrupted soul adds power to Asmodeus and denies it to the Lords of Good. But the King of Hell realized that there were some souls too good to be corrupted and too powerful to be allowed into Heaven, such as those of heroic paladins and clerics. He created the oubliettes to be living prisons of flesh. When a devil noble or Lord of Hell wants a troublesome champion of good removed, an infernal strike force is assembled that includes an oubliette.
Stealer of souls

An oubliette extends a long tentacle from its stomach, and when the oubliette or another devil kills a creature, the oubliette snatches the creature's head and mounts it on the end of its tentacle. The oubliette's hideous nature keeps the head both alive and conscious
Eternal evil

An oubliette lives for millennia unless slain, and for all that time the good soul trapped within is lost to Heaven. To make matters worse, oubliettes wander throughout Hell, making their charges watch the unspeakable evil that goes on there. A century or two of unending horror is enough to drive most mortals mad. Some even begin to enjoy the spectacle; these are Asmodeus's greatest triumphs. When this happens, the oubliette can safely smash the head apart and release the now-evil soul to join the host of Hell.
Constructed nature
An oubliette doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Shocking Appearance
entries: When a creature that can see the painshrieker starts its turn within 60 feet of the painshrieker, the painshrieker's horrifying appearance forces the creature to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw if the painshrieker is not {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature also suffers short-term madness (see the Dungeon

trait.name: Master's Guide
entries: At the end of the {@condition frightened} creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw and ends the {@condition frightened} effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw to resist or ends the {@condition frightened} effect becomes immune to the painshrieker's Shocking Appearance for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The painshrieker makes two hand scythe attacks.

action.name: Hand Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sonic Barrage (1/Day)
entries: The painshrieker screams into a 60-foot-long cone for 3 rounds or until the painshrieker moves, uses an action, or becomes {@condition incapacitated}. When the painshrieker uses its Sonic

Barrage, each creature in the area takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage. A creature that takes this damage must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at the start of its turn, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or just half the damage on a successful one.

While Duchess Hadriel prefers female servants, she knows how to use men when it suits her. The painshriekers, a common form of Submitter, are a case in point. Painshriekers are recruited from the most ardent of Hadriel's male mortal followers. Such is their desire to please their mistress that they willingly submit to the agonizing process of transformation. Like strigae, they are first blinded. They are then slit open from navel to chin, and large segments of their internal organs are removed and replaced with a vibratory superstructure that projects an ultrasonic beam. The new painshriekers remain blind until the grafts heal, at which time they can "see" again with their implanted sonic generator. They also learn to create a powerful sonic attack.
Infernal soldiers

Hadriel uses the painshriekers as shock troops. Their inhuman appearance and sonic barrage make them much-feared opponents. Since Hadriel is operating in the shadows at the moment, painshriekers are rarely seen on the Material Plane. They are kept in several remote forest keeps, waiting to burst forth on the duchess's command.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The darksphinx's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The darksphinx can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The darksphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the darksphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: A darksphinx has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The darksphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Springing Strike
entries: If the darksphinx moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the darksphinx can move away from that target without triggering an opportunity attack from it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The darksphinx makes three attacks: two with its longsword and one with its tail slap.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage

Sphinxes normally see themselves above the fray when it comes to the struggle between light and dark, good and evil. However, sometimes a sphinx gains Hell's attention and might find itself drawn into darkness against its will. 0Darksphinxes are raised in Hell and learn at Hadriel's feet, trained as bodyguards and instilled with utter loyalty to the duchess. Hadriel awards them to her most trusted lieutenants and occasionally to other devil nobles as well. A darksphinx bodyguard is very prestigious and highly sought after in Hell. Many suspect that these "bodyguards" are nothing more than spies for Hadriel, but that has never been proven. Although their job may seem simple, the darksphinxes enjoy their work. Protecting an important personage from assassination in Hell is a never-ending intellectual sport, and second-guessing creatures bred to be deceptive is no easy task. The appearance of darksphinxes makes their lineage clear, but they stand upright like humanoids and prefer to use weapons in combat.
Hadriel's plotting

Duchess Hadriel long admired the gynosphinx. Fierce, enigmatic, and unbelievably intelligent, gynosphinxes were everything that Hadriel aspired to be. When she became the Duchess of Domination, Hadriel sought out several gynosphinxes and tried to attract them to her entourage, without success. The creatures would not be wooed by power or prestige. Hadriel decided to approach the problem differently. She visited a powerful gynosphinx named Newella and challenged her to a battle of wits. If Newella won, Hadriel would become her servant. If Hadriel won, Newella would mate with the male of Hadriel's choosing. The contestants posed a dozen riddles and logic puzzles to each other. Newella missed but a single answer, but that was enough. She was forced to mate with Hadriel's husband, Duke Bifrons. The resulting half-fiend offspring were the first darksphinxes.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While it is attached to a target, the spineseeker takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature to which it is attached takes the other half.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: A spineseeker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: A spineseeker's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d4 + 7}) piercing damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, the spineseeker attaches to it. While attached, the spineseeker doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the spineseeker's turns, the target loses 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points due to blood loss.

The spineseeker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can use its action to attempt to detach the spineseeker. A creature must contest a Strength check against the spineseeker's Dexterity check. On a success, the creature tears the spineseeker free, dealing 7 ({@damage 3d4}) piercing damage to the target to which it was attached.

While attached to the target, the spineseeker winds its tendrils around the target's spinal cord. Whenever the target takes a turn, it must contest a Charisma check against the spineseeker's Wisdom check. If the target succeeds, it can act normally during its turn. If the target fails, the spineseeker decides how the target takes its turn, as if the target were under the effects of a dominate monster spell.

Voracious predators that seemingly exist only to feed, spineseekers pose a serious threat to even the demonic residents of the Abyss. A spineseeker's dull gray body can reach a length of four feet, though specimens half that size are far more common. All spineseekers are hermaphroditic and reproduce by mating. A pregnant spineseeker can give birth to up to thirty-six young, disgorging them from its three mouths in a mass of stomach acid and pulpy afterbirth.
Deadly infestations

Whenever a colony of these creatures finds its way into a demon settlement, the demons do everything within their power to destroy the incursion. More devious demons can be seen at the heart of such battles, squatting over injured spineseekers, forcing the creatures into specially prepared magical cages. Despite the danger they pose—and likely because of it—spineseekers represent an important commodity in the Abyss.
Horrid killers

Though far from stupid, spineseekers have no language and don't seem to care whom they attack. They cannot be reasoned with and know nothing of mercy or compassion. They make incredibly effective assassins since their lack of communication makes it extremely difficult to track the killing back to its sponsor. Demons (or even mortals) wishing to use spineseekers in this manner trap them in containers known as {@item stasis cage|bookoffiends}s (see the Stasis Cages sidebar for details), which are then opened in the presence of the intended target. It doesn't always work. Sometimes the spineseeker attacks the bearer of the {@item stasis cage|bookoffiends}. Usually, however, it flies right to its mark and begins its grisly work.
In the name

Spineseekers get their name from their favorite combat tactic, which involves grappling (often larger) opponents. Once it has grabbed an enemy, a spineseeker attempts to attach itself to the creature's spine, draining it of vitality, while at the same time controlling its motor functions.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: On the first round of each combat, the mindkiller has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mindkiller remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a mass of briars.

trait.name: Nettles
entries: A creature that touches the mindkiller, is {@condition grappled} by it, or is hit by its Brush attack, is stung with its neurotoxic nettles. The creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking
{@damage 1d6} poison damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Additionally, if the creature fails its saving throw, the nettles bury into its flesh.

Removing these minute stingers requires a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check using a healer's kit made over the course of 1 hour. Until the creature's nettles are removed, its hit point maximum is reduced by 1 every 24 hours, and whenever it attempts to rest, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw.
On a failure, the creature gains no benefits from its rest. A spell of lesser restoration or similar magic can remove the nettles.

action.name: Brush
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.
Additionally, the creature is subjected to the mindkiller's Nettles ability.

reaction.name: Feed on Suffering
entries: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of the mindkiller fails its Constitution saving throw against the mindkiller's Nettles ability, the mindkiller gains {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points, which last up to one minute

monster.name: Crun
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (works only on creatures that speak Abyssal)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The crun can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Body
entries: A creature that touches the crun or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the crun remains motionless in water, it is indistinguishable from normal water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The crun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The crun's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Slime Trail
entries: For each foot the crun moves, it leaves behind a streak of slippery, corrosive slime that lasts until the start of its next turn. Any creature moving across a surface covered in the slime must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the crun must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the crun's stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage. If the creature is Medium or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

While {@condition grappled} by the crun, the creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the crun's turns. When the crun moves, the {@condition grappled} creature moves with it.
The crun can have one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hydraggon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Psychic Beacon
entries: When the hydraggon takes damage, each hydraggon within 100 miles knows it.

trait.name: Styx Immunity
entries: The hydraggon is immune to the memory-stealing effects of the River Styx.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydraggon attacks twice: once with its trident and once with its morningstar.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fascination (1/Day)
entries: The hydraggon changes its coloration and posture to create a beguiling display that overloads the senses of creatures who can see it. Each creature within 30 feet of the hydraggon that is not a fiend must succeed on a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the {@condition incapacitated} creature's turns or whenever it takes damage, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Fascination for the next 24 hours.

The stretch of the River Styx that winds its way through the Abyss used to positively teem with hydraggons, the dominant form of aquatic qlippoth. When the celestial host began to ravage the Howling Threshold, legions of hydraggons rose up to fight them and died in a holocaust of holy fire. The remaining hydraggons fled into the depths of the river. Since the Styx is incalculably long, the hydraggons split up and hid in stretches of the river throughout the Lower Planes. The celestial armies dared not follow them to Hell and Hades, lest they touch off a war even they could not win. Thousands of hydraggons were killed by devils, daemons, and other horrors of the Styx, but a core survived and even came to thrive in their adversity. Now hydraggons can be found throughout the River Styx. Although they are clearly of fiendish origin, few know they are from the Abyss. It is rumored that a colony of hydraggons also escaped to the Material Plane, but if this is so, their lair remains well hidden. Hydraggons do not usually congregate in large numbers, since they've found it easier to pass unnoticed in small groups. In dire situations, though, it can be critical for all hydraggons in the area to coalesce quickly. The hydraggons developed their natural telepathic abilities, so now each can create a psychic homing beacon to make the most of their limited numbers.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Balan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Hellish Weapons
entries: Balan's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

trait.name: (spell save {@dc 17})
entries: Balan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
3/day each: dispel magic, dominate beast, find the path, wind wall
1/day: plane shift

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Balan fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The devil's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Balan has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of Balan's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: Balan's proficiency bonus is doubled for any Wisdom (Perception) check he makes (included). He also has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of Balan's heads is asleep, his other heads are awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Balan makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage. When Balan makes a ranged attack with this weapon, the weapon teleports to his hand.

action.name: Flight of the Hunters (1/Day)
entries: At night, each creature of Balan's choice that he can see gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed
+ 10 feet that lasts for 12 hours or until the creature is touched by the light of dawn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Balan makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Attack Command
entries: One creature of Balan's choice within 30 feet that he can see can use a reaction to make a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Balan and a creature he is riding magically teleport to an unoccupied space he can see within 120 feet.

Balan, a three-headed beast of a devil, is a noble in the service of Belial, Lord of the Fourth Circle. As Master of the Infernal Hunt, Balan organizes hunts for Belial's sport on the Fourth Circle. These inevitably revolve around stalking and killing rogue devils or bands of invaders. The noted paladin Flavius was caught in one such hunt, and he and his followers were slain to a man. Belial also periodically releases Balan and his Infernal Hunt onto the Material Plane. This is a real treat for the old devil. He gathers together a pack of fiendish beasts, hell hounds, and devils. They appear at night, howling through the sky and landing to reap souls and cause untold destruction. Each hunt has a special target chosen by Belial (such as a troublesome crusading church), but the Master of the Infernal Hunt has free rein to continue his merry ride until he's had his fill of bloodletting. Balan and Mammon, Lord of the Third Circle, are great rivals as sportsmen. Mammon leads his own hunt, and devils can only speculate what would happen if the two were ever to meet.
The infernal hunt

Balan is usually encountered with his hunt, which ranges in size from a dozen creatures to over a hundred. A typical hunt includes his hunter Beldrake and 3d6 hell hounds. The hunt uses its great numbers and speed to run enemies to ground and tear them apart.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Fleshtearer has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Fleshtearer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Fleshtearer's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fleshtearer makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons

trait.name: Crown of Fire
entries: When the ignagon takes 20 damage or more from a single attack, flames burst from its crown into a 30-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or just half this damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Flaming Body
entries: A creature that touches the ignagon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The ignagon sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

trait.name: Infernal Beacon
entries: All friendly devils within 120 feet of the ignagon that can see it are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ignagon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ignagon makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Flaming Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

One cannot fail to see the ignagons. Standing twenty feet tall, wearing blackened crowns upon their heads, with bodies wreathed in hellfire, they wade through enemies, knocking them aside with each swing of their mighty fists. Although fearsome in their own right, their mere presence inspires other devils, stiffening their spines and firming their resolve to keep fighting even against overwhelming numbers.
Wicked tyrants

Hell recognizes the differences between souls that walk through its iron gates. Most of the damned face transformation into manes, devils situated at the very bottom of the plane's hierarchy. In time they might ascend to higher positions, earning new bodies to match, but most just languish among the lowly. However, when a soul belonging to a great tyrant, brutal warlord, or despicable despot finds its way to Hell, it is set aside, its fate much different. These souls become infernal beacons for the devils on the battlefields, transformed into towering figures tasked with leading the charge against Hell's enemies. One might think such a position to be a promotion, but, in truth, ignagons suffer like all the rest, forced to fight and die for uncaring masters.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons

trait.name: Awaken the Dead
entries: As a bonus action, a dead humanoid Malgrin touches becomes a skeleton or zombie under his control as if he had created the creature with the animate dead spell. Unlike the spell, there is no limit to the number of undead he can create. Undead he creates have advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Malgrin that starts its turn within 20 feet of him must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, unless Malgrin is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Malgrin's Fear Aura for 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Malgrin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The devil's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Malgrin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unholy Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Malgrin makes a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Grave Grasp
entries: Malgrin targets one creature on the ground that he can see within 60 feet. A bony hand reaches up to grab the target.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).
Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Malgrin magically teleport, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 120 feet.
Duke of Unlife

A powerful noble of the First Circle of Hell, Malgrin tries to curry favor with Lord Baal by winning military victories and has chosen a novel way to do so. Most armies on the First Circle are composed, naturally enough, of devils. They are in near-constant conflict with their perpetual enemies, demons, but also face internal threats. Devils are simply too interested in their own advancement to make trustworthy subordinates. Malgrin should know—he rose to his position by assassinating his former boss. Once in charge, he decided to secure his position by increasing the undead forces under his command. There were plenty of corpses to make troops from, and he found their obedience pleasing. Moreover, his fiendish skeletons cannot be turned while in Hell. Now known as the Duke of Unlife, Malgrin has a huge undead horde under his command. His officers are not devils at all, but necromancers of various races who have pledged themselves to him. The implacable advance of the duke's legions has routed both demons and rival devils.
Secret plots

To most outside observers, Malgrin seems content to rule his necromantic fiefdom, though none can say what really lurks in the heart of the Duke of Unlife. Other nobles of the First Circle whisper in their lord's ear. They say that Malgrin is planning a move and that he wants to turn the entirety of Baal's realm into a boneyard. The archdevil may harbor some suspicions, but right now he values the duke's armies too much to take any action.
Malgrin's lair

When not in the field leading his armies, Malgrin lurks within the corridors of the Bone Citadel, a grim fortress built on the banks of a river of blood. Twitching corpses and the animated bones of his victims litter the corridors and chambers of his complex. Encountered in his lair, Malgrin has a challenge rating of 22 (41,000 XP).
Lair actions
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Malgrin takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Malgrin can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

• A bone spike erupts from a point on the floor within 120 feet of Malgrin. One creature of Malgrin's choice within 5 feet of the spike must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) piercing damage and become impaled on the spike until the end of its next turn. An impaled creature's speed is 0.

• A foul stench of rotting meat fills the air inside a sphere with a 60-foot radius centered on a point within 120 feet of Malgrin. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against poison or become poisoned until the end of its next turn.

• The corpse of each dead humanoid creature inside a 30-foot cube originating from a point within 120 feet of Malgrin animates to become a skeleton or zombie (Malgrin's choice). The creatures act on initiative count 0 and obey all of Malgrin's men- tal commands.
Regional effects
The region around the Bone Citadel is infested with negative energy flowing from the Duke of Unlife, creating one or more of the following effects:
• Creatures making death saving throws within 1 mile of the Bone Citadel make the saves with disadvantage.

• Bits of flesh, bone, and hair found in the landscape within 1 mile of the lair sometimes clump together and waddle about as if they were creatures. Harmless, they move in this way for a few moments before falling apart.
• Undead within 1 mile of the Bone Citadel have advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.
If Malgrin dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ahrimanes's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). Ahrimanes can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Ahrimanes knows if he hears a lie.

trait.name: Fallen Weapons
entries: Ahrimanes's weapon attacks are magical. When
Ahrimanes hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 22 ({@dice 5d8})necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ahrimanes fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Ahrimanes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Vexing Flies (1/Day)
entries: Ahrimanes's face is a seething mass of wriggling maggots. As a bonus action, Ahrimanes can cause
{@dice 1d4 + 1} swarm of flies (treat as a swarm of insects, as found in

Appendix A of the Monster Manual, but with a walking speed of 5 feet and a flying speed of 30 feet) to move out from his space into a space Ahrimanes chooses within 5 feet of him. The swarm of flies rolls initiative and takes the next available turn, under
Ahrimanes's control.

trait.name: Unsettling Presence
entries: A 150-foot radius of disturbance extends out from Ahrimanes, moves with him, and spreads around corners.

Each beast that starts its turn in the area or moves into it must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. The creature becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or becomes immune to Ahrimanes's

Unsettling Presence for 24 hours on a successful one. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way must take the Dash action on each of its turns to move away from Ahrimanes by the safest available route.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ahrimanes makes three attacks: one with his whip, one with his bite, and one with his claws. He can substitute Harmful
Touch for his claws attack.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d4 + 7}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

Harmful Touch (4/Day) Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}52 ({@damage 11d8 + 3}) necrotic damage and the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw and ends the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Ahrimanes moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Probe Soul
entries: Ahrimanes probes the soul of one creature he can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target grants Ahrimanes advantage on attack rolls he makes against it. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw and ends the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Whip Attack
entries: Ahrimanes makes a whip attack.

Before the angelic rebellion in heaven—before the fall of those angels and their subsequent descent to the Abyss and Hell—there was Ahrimanes. An angel, like so many of his brethren that fell from grace, he never exhibited the purity of his fellow celestials. Despite dwelling in the presence of the gods, he could never accept that these beings could have created him. He watched their bickering and childish behavior in shock, horrified by the power they controlled and disgusted by their capriciousness and infighting. He grew to hate them, and, in his hate, he fomented discord in his kind, forming the first rebellion against the gods. His arrogance allowed him to believe he could walk unchallenged in Heaven, talking freely of the pettiness of the immortal masters and their misguided use of power. He gathered a motley host of sycophants to his side, composed of those who saw things as he did, or perhaps they joined because they saw power in him. When their meetings turned violent, the gods would brook no more offense and demanded that Ahrimanes and his followers be cast out of the Heavens. Those angels who enforced the gods' will were Iblis, Sariel, and Beelzebub, who would eventually rise up against their divine masters when the gods created mortals, inspired by the words of Ahrimanes. Ahrimanes's ejection from the Heavens occurred before Hell was formed and while the qlippoth still ruled unchallenged in the dark, away from the gods. No mortal world yet existed, so Ahrimanes wandered the shadows of the cosmos, too afraid to find shelter with the soulless in the yawning depths of the Abyss. Filled with hatred for all of his kind, he nursed his grief and loneliness for a thousand years, until mortal man first drew his breath on a world created just for him. Soon after, Ahrimanes watched his fellow angels—those that ignored his warnings and cast him from the light of the Heavens—struggle futilely against the combined might of the Heavens. He watched as Asmodeus, his heir, fell from the Heavens to land in a new place, a place of torment and woe, where the gods would give over mortals of similar disposition to the hateful devils. He laughed gleefully when the others fell to the Abyss and struggled for survival against the qlippoth. In the end, with these fiendish realms created and with demons and devils established in their new realms, Ahrimanes returned from his exile and settled in Gehenna, doing his part to corrupt the mortals and send them to their dark masters. He has an uneasy truce with the exarchs, though each suspects he plots to seize the entire plane for his own. Given his charismatic nature and bottomless corruption, it is a threat that all would do well not to ignore.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't made with adamantine

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The construct is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Infernal Heat
entries: A creature that touches the construct or hits with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The construct has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The construct's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Nova
entries: When a demolisher is destroyed, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area.

trait.name: Stoke the Flames
entries: Whenever the demolisher is subjected to fire or lightning damage, it takes no damage and its infernal heat deals an additional {@damage 2d10} fire damage until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demolisher makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Into the Furnace {@recharge}
entries: The Vulcan demolisher makes a slam attack against one Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it.

On a hit, the demolisher also dumps the target inside the furnace that makes up its torso, trapping it there. A creature trapped inside the furnace is {@condition restrained}, has half cover against attacks and other effects outside the demolisher, and takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage at the start of each of the demolisher's turns. A demolisher can have only one creature trapped in this way at a time.

If the demolisher takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature trapped inside it, the furnace doors open and the creature falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the demolisher. If the demolisher dies, a trapped creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from its remains by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

Vulcan demolishers lumber across the battlefields, shaking the ground as they walk. Huge, headless constructs made from iron, hellish flames flare out of their joints and when they swing their arms. They leave trails of sparks in their wake. Their torsos, clearly the most interesting part of these monsters, are giant furnaces that glow white-hot with some inner conflagration. Metal portcullises raise and lower before them, making a resounding din, like the tolling of a bell.
In Hell's defense

Vulcan demolishers lumber across the battlefields, shaking the ground as they walk. Huge, headless constructs made from iron, hellish flames flare out of their joints and when they swing their arms. They leave trails of sparks in their wake. Their torsos, clearly the most interesting part of these monsters, are giant furnaces that glow white-hot with some inner conflagration. Metal portcullises raise and lower before them, making a resounding din, like the tolling of a bell.
Constructed nature
A Vulcan demolisher doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Sound the Horn {@recharge 5}
entries: Beldrake blows his horn, sending a wave of thunderous force into a 100-foot-long cone originating from the horn. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute on a failed saving throw, or just takes half the damage on a successful one.

Balan's huntsman is a special office in the retinue of Balan (see Balan, earlier in this chapter). The officeholder benefits from Balan's blessings and carries Balan's horn. Each year Balan's followers compete in a great hunt on the Fourth Circle of Hell. The Master of the Infernal Hunt releases an infernal beast with a silver ring around its neck, and the devil who brings the ring back becomes Balan's hunter for the following year. That is the only rule. Only the most clever and vicious devils have a chance of winning this contest: the current huntsman, Beldrake, beheaded three rivals to capture the silver ring. Balan is most pleased with him. When Balan organizes an expedition to the Material Plane, it is the huntsman's duty to travel ahead and scout the way. He reconnoiters the terrain, picks out worthy targets, and eliminates prying eyes. When all is ready, he blows his horn of office, which summons the entire hunt to the Material Plane. Then, the mayhem begins. When Balan has had his fill of slaughter, Balan's huntsman sounds his horn again, and the infernal pack returns to Hell.
Humtsman's horn

Balan possesses an impressive horn, a gift given to him by Belial several millennia ago, and allows his chosen hunter to bear it while on the hunt. Carved from the yellowed tooth of an ancient silver dragon, tipped with adamantine, and enchanted with dark magic, the horn celebrates the power of Hell. If the hunter is slain, the horn teleports to Balan. If Balan is slain, the horn teleports to Belial's treasure vault instead.

action.name: Sparagmos
entries: The flesh sculptor targets one {@condition incapacitated} creature within 5 feet of it and forces the target to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the flesh sculptor disassembles the target's body. The creature does not die, but is instead reduced to a collection of body parts. While a collection of body parts, the creature cannot take actions or move and it automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws and makes all other saving throws with disadvantage. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic can restore a disassembled creature. A target that survives this experience must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or suffer a random long-term madness.

action.name: Remake
entries: The flesh sculptor targets one collection of body parts within 5 feet of it and reassembles the parts in a way it finds pleasing.

An affected target makes all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage, has its speed reduced to 5 feet, and grants advantage on all attack rolls made against it. A {@spell greater restoration} spell returns a remade target back to a collection of body parts.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it becomes {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and Hadriel can automatically hit the target with her bone hook, but she cannot use that bone hook to attack a different target. Hadriel cannot have more than two targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Hadriel's choice that is within 20 feet of her and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Hadriel's
Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Rend the Flesh
entries: Hadriel wrenches a bone hook from a creature she has {@condition grappled}. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or just half this damage on a successful one.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Hadriel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Hadriel's choice). She reverts to her true form if she dies.
In a new form, Hadriel retains her alignment, hit points, Hit

Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. The creature must also succeed on {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the creature's turns that it remains {@condition poisoned}, it must repeat the saving throw. The creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or ends the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself on a successful save.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the malicious lieutenant can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, a malicious lieutenant can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the lieutenant that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Stability
entries: The malicious lieutenant has advantage on contests made to avoid being shoved and on saving throws to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Wrathful Command {@recharge}
entries: The malicious lieutenant can take a bonus action to cause each malicious footman friendly to it and within 60 feet of it to either end the wrathful frenzy effect on itself or use it if it has uses remaining.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malicious lieutenant makes three attacks: two with its halberd and one with its tongue.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of the {@condition poisoned} creature's turns, it can make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw and ends the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Daemonic Shriek
entries: The malicious lieutenant throws back its head and shrieks. Each fiend friendly to the lieutenant that is within 30 feet of it and can hear the shriek rolls a {@dice d6} whenever it makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and adds the number rolled on the {@dice d6} to its result. The effect lasts 1 minute. Each other creature within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any malicious lieutenant's Daemonic Shriek for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the malicious captain can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the malicious captain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, a malicious captain can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the captain that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Stability
entries: The malicious captain has advantage on contests made to avoid being shoved and on saving throws to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: While the malicious captain is within 30 feet of at least one of its allies and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}, the captain makes saving throws with advantage.

trait.name: Wrathful Command {@recharge}
entries: The malicious captain can take a bonus action to cause each malicious footman friendly to it and within 60 feet of it to either end the wrathful frenzy effect on itself or use it if it has uses remaining.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malicious captain makes three attacks: one with its impalers, one with its claws, and one with its tongue.

action.name: Impalers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or take 17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage. The malicious captain can grapple one target at a time.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, and the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until the {@condition poisoned} effect ends, the target deals half damage with melee attacks. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw and ends the {@condition poisoned} effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Snapping Tongue
entries: The malicious captain makes a tongue attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The malicious captain moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Attack Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The malicious captain issues a command to one daemon friendly to it that is within 60 feet and can hear the command. The target daemon can use a reaction to take the
Attack action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The harbinger of vengeance's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The harbinger of vengeance can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the harbinger of vengeance can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Decapitate
entries: The harbinger of vengeance can take a bonus action to tear the head from an {@condition incapacitated} creature within 5 feet of it and add the head to its collection. The creature dies immediately. If the creature is later restored to life by magic, it gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The harbinger of vengeance's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Severed-Head Collection
entries: The harbinger of vengeance has 3 ({@dice 1d4}
+ 1) severed heads harvested from its victims. It can replace them using decapitate.

trait.name: Whispers of Wrath {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the harbinger telepathically whispers to one creature it can see that is within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I destroy anyone who crosses me." In addition, for 1 minute after the target becomes {@condition charmed}, it is consumed by a need for vengeance against a creature the harbinger chooses that is within 120 feet of the target and that the target can see. On each of the target's turns, it must take the Attack action against the chosen creature, moving toward it if necessary, or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. At the end of each of the {@condition charmed} target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself with a success. A target becomes immune to this harbinger's Whispers of Wrath for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or the effect ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harbinger makes two claws attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Severed Head
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the severed head explodes in a 15-foot radius, showering everything in the area with bits of bone and brains.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The stoker's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The stoker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the stoker's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the stoker or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Stoke the Flames
entries: Whenever a creature within 30 feet of the stoker takes damage from an attack made by a creature other than the stoker, the range of the stoker's Fire Aura increases by 5 feet until the end of the stoker's next turn.

trait.name: Whispers of Wrath {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the stoker telepathically whispers to one creature it can see that is within 120 feet, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw.
On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption

Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I am angry all the time and the slightest offense sets me off." In addition, until this effect ends, all creatures, both allies and enemies, trigger opportunity attacks when they move out of the affected creature's reach, and the affected creature must make the opportunity attack whenever it can do so. A target becomes immune to this inciter's Whispers of Wrath for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or the effect ends.

action.name: Fiery Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the inciter reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the inciter can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inciter makes three attacks: one with its claws, one with its bite, and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, U'ulgan can move up to his speed toward a hostile creature that he can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If U'ulgan fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: U'ulgan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: U'ulgan's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, U'ulgan can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature he hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of U'ulgan that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Stability
entries: U'ulgan has advantage on contests made to avoid being shoved and on saving throws to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: U'ulgan makes four attacks: two with Gyvast the Foe's
Bane, one with his body blades, and one with his tongue or stomp.

action.name: Gyvast the Foe's Bane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage. A humanoid target takes an additional 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage. If U'ulgan scores a critical hit, he rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice. (See Gyvast the Foe's Bane later in this chapter for details on this magic item.)

action.name: Body Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d12 + 9}) piercing damage plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage, and the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until the {@condition poisoned} effect ends, the target deals half damage with melee attacks. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw and ends the {@condition poisoned} effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Stomp
entries: U'ulgan slams his foot on the ground, sending a shock wave out in a 30-foot radius centered on a point he can reach. Each creature on the ground in the area other than U'ulgan must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or just takes half the damage on a successful one.

action.name: Open the Gates (1/Day)
entries: U'ulgan opens a black portal with a 30-foot radius centered on a point within 300 feet of him that remains for as long as U'ulgan concentrates, up to 1 minute. The portal has a front and a back, but is {@condition invisible} from the side. A creature moving through the portal travels from the plane on which the portal was opened to a place of the GM's choice within the Circle of Wrath on Gehenna.

At the end of each of U'ulgan's turns while the portal remains open, {@dice 3d6} malicious footmen move out from the portal. For every 20 malicious footmen to emerge from the portal, 1 malicious lieutenant moves out from the portal. For every 4 malicious lieutenants that appear, a malicious captain moves out from the portal. Daemons that come through the portal are friendly to U'ulgan, obey his commands, and remain until destroyed.

legendary.name: Darting Tongue
entries: U'ulgan makes a tongue attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: U'ulgan magically teleports to an unoccupied space that he can see within 120 feet of him.

legendary.name: Attack Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: U'ulgan issues a command to one daemon friendly to him that is within 60 feet and can hear the command. The target daemon can use a reaction to take the
Attack action.

legendary.name: Hack and Hew (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: U'ulgan makes a Gyvast the Foe
Bane attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the vecrose can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Daemonic Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The vecrose howls. Each creature that is not a fiend and is within 60 feet of the daemon must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become enraged for 1 minute or until the creature drops to 0 hit points. While enraged, the creature gains all of the following benefits and drawbacks:

items: The creature is {@condition charmed} by the vecrose and hostile to all other creatures.
The creature makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage.
The creature's melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} damage.

The creature can only take the Attack action and must choose its targets randomly. If there is no target within the creature's reach or range, the creature must move toward the nearest creature it can see.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, an enraged creature can repeat the Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself with a success. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this effect becomes immune to this vecrose's use of Daemonic Howl for 24 hours.

trait.name: Wrathful Power
entries: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of the vecrose becomes enraged, uses the Rage class feature, or benefits from a similar ability, the vecrose gains 10 temporary hit points.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the wrathful can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wrathful has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Litany of Complaints
entries: The bearer of false burdens continuously complains about its lot, the sound of which magically assaults the minds of creatures who hear it. At the start of each of the bearer's turns, each creature within 30 feet that can hear the complaints must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bearer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Weighty Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it reduces its speed by 10 feet. If the reduction drops the target's speed to 0 feet, the target becomes {@condition petrified}, turning into a block of iron. If the target does not become {@condition petrified}, the reduction to its speed lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Covetous
entries: When a creature the bitter can see hits on an attack roll, the bitter makes its next attack roll against the triggering creature with advantage.

trait.name: Undead Rebirth
entries: When the bitter drops to 0 hit points, it dies. At the start of its next turn, the skin sloughs off its body, and it regains all its hit points, becomes undead, and stands up. It uses the same statistics that it had before the transformation, but it becomes vulnerable to bludgeoning damage and immune to {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The calumnite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The calumnite's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The calumnite can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Whispers of Envy {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the calumnite telepathically whispers to one creature within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target has a new flaw: "I covet everything I see." In addition, for 1 minute after becoming {@condition charmed}, the target becomes hostile to all creatures. On each of the target's turns, it must move up to its speed by the safest available route to one of its former allies. If the target moves to within 5 feet of one of its former allies, it must take an action to hinder the creature, which imposes disadvantage on the creature's next attack roll, ability check, and saving throw made before the start of the target's next turn. If the target cannot move to within 5 feet of one of its former allies, it becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

At the end of the target's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this calumnite's Whispers of Envy for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The calumnite makes two impaler attacks. The calumnite can substitute mouth tentacles in place of one impaler attack.

action.name: Impaler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The calumnite has two impalers, each of which can grab one target.

action.name: Mouth Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The creature suffers Intelligence drain until it finishes a long rest. A creature suffering from Intelligence drain must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from every Intelligence attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes. Each time the creature suffers Intelligence drain again, the die it rolls increases to the next higher size, such that a {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, and a {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}. If the die becomes a {@dice d20}, the target becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it is no longer suffering from Intelligence drain. A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the drained creature ends the effect on it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crausus's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The crausus can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Barbed Body
entries: At the start of its turn, the crausus deals 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The crausus's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The crausus can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Whispers of Envy {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the crausus telepathically whispers to one creature within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects
Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw:

"I spread lies about people I envy." In addition, for 1 minute after becoming {@condition charmed}, the target becomes hostile to one creature of the crausus's choice. On each of the target's turns, it must use its action to attack the chosen creature using the best methods available to it.
If the target ends its turn without attacking the chosen creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

At the end of the target's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this crausus's Whispers of Envy for 24 hours.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target suffers Wisdom drain until it finishes a long rest. A creature suffering from Wisdom drain must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from every Wisdom attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes. Each time the creature suffers Wisdom drain again, the die it rolls increases to the next higher size, such that a {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, and a {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}. If the die becomes a {@dice d20}, the target becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it is no longer suffering from Wisdom drain. A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the drained creature ends the effect on it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fair one's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The fair one can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of combat, the fair one has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the fair one can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The fair one can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} by this effect, the target is also {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A target that saves against the poison or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this fair one's poison for 24 hours.

action.name: Flense
entries: The fair one strips the skin from one {@condition paralyzed} creature within 5 feet of it. Constructs, plants, and undead are immune.

The target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage. If the target drops to 0 hit points, it loses all the skin from its body. The loss of its skin imposes disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws the target makes. The target also becomes vulnerable to acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, piercing, radiant, slashing, and thunder damage. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or more powerful magic ends the effect and restores the target's skin to its body

trait.name: Accursed Form
entries: Mother Igwyre is immune to any effect that would change her form.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of combat, Mother Igwyre has advantage on attack rolls against any creature she has surprised.

trait.name: Corrosive Tears
entries: When a creature moves to within 5 feet of Mother
Igwyre or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Mother Igwyre fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Mother Igwyre's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Mother Igwyre can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Piteous Weeping
entries: Mother Igwyre weeps constantly, and the sound of her suffering erodes the mind. At the end of Mother Igwyre's turn, each creature within 60 feet of her that can hear her must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage. If this damage drops a creature to 0 hit points, it gains an indefinite madness.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Mother Igwyre can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, Mother Igwyre knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: Mother Igwyre ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mother Igwyre makes two slam attacks and a bite attack. She can substitute a Web attack for one of her slams.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}53 ({@damage 8d10 + 9}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.
While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature is {@condition charmed}. Whenever the creature takes damage, it can make a {@dc 23} Charisma saving throw.

On a success, the creature suppresses the {@condition charmed} condition for 1 minute. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Web
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 17} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 24} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp
30; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Mother Igwyre's choice that is within 120 feet of Mother Igwyre and is aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Mother
Igwyre's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: Mother Igwyre makes a slam attack.

legendary.name: Web
entries: Mother Igwyre makes a Web attack.

legendary.name: Scuttle
entries: Mother Igwyre moves up to her speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Horrid Wailing (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Mother Igwyre releases a horrid wail. Each creature within 120 feet of her that can hear the wail and is not a fiend must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Heap of Bones
entries: A ruin in flesh carries a heap of bones on its back, made up from bodies it has absorbed. Whenever the ruin in flesh takes bludgeoning damage, the bones splinter and fly in all directions, forcing each creature within 10 feet of the ruin to make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage on a failed save. If the ruin in flesh takes 20 bludgeoning damage or more from a single attack, it loses its Heap of Bones trait and its Armor Class drops to 10 until it has killed at least three creatures with Absorb Flesh.

trait.name: Horrifying Appearance
entries: When a creature that can see the ruin in flesh starts its turn within 60 feet of the ruin, the ruin's horrifying appearance forces the creature to make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw if the ruin is not {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature also suffers short-term madness (see the Dungeon Master's Guide for more details). At the end of the {@condition frightened} creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw and ends the {@condition frightened} effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw to resist or end the {@condition frightened} effect becomes immune to this ruin in flesh's horrifying appearance for 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Absorb Flesh
entries: The ruin moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the ruin enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw.

On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the ruin. A creature that chooses not to be pushed or can't be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.
