On a failed save, the ruin enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage and is partially absorbed. A partially absorbed creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the ruin's turns. When the ruin moves, the absorbed creature moves with it.

An absorbed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage, escapes, and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ruin.

An absorbed creature that drops to 0 hit points dies immediately, and its soul is consumed by the ruin in flesh, which prevents the creature from being restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.
The ruin in flesh regains 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points after consuming a soul

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The weeping coils' innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The weeping coils can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Killing Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the weeping coils and the two of them can see each other, the weeping coils can force the creature to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw if the weeping coils isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the {@condition stunned} effect on itself becomes immune to this weeping coils' Killing Gaze for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The weeping coils makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and the weeping coils can't constrict another creature.

reaction.name: Harvest Success
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the weeping coils hits with an attack roll or succeeds on an ability check or saving throw, the weeping coils can harvest the creature's success. Until the end of the creature's next turn, the next time it makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, it makes the roll with disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Aezidion's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 26}). Aezidion can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Aezidion can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aura of Sensation
entries: At the start of each of Aezidion's turns, each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 26} Charisma saving throw. Constructs, elementals, plants, and undead are immune to this effect. A creature that fails the saving throw becomes {@condition incapacitated} from experiencing an overwhelming mixture of pleasure and pain. A creature {@condition incapacitated} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect becomes immune to Aezidion's Aura of Sensation for 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Aezidion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Aezidion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Aezidion's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aezidion makes one pseudopod attack and uses its
Horrid Coupling attack for each object of desire it has created.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Desire Revealed
entries: Aezidion targets up to three creatures within range of its telepathy. Constructs, elementals, plants, and undead are immune to this effect. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage. For each creature that takes this damage, Aezidion creates from its own flesh a creature that perfectly matches whatever being the damaged creature desires most. The creation remains until Aezidion uses

Desire Revealed again. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw becomes immune to Desire Revealed for 24 hours. While a creature can see the object of its desire, it has disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

An object of desire created by this effect remains part of Aezidion, though it looks, feels, and sounds exactly like what the target imagines. The object of desire cannot move more than 120 feet away from Aezidion, as several strands of flesh connect it to the daemon's body. These strands are immune to damage but break if there is not a
1-inch-wide opening between the object of desire and Aezidion.

action.name: Horrid Embrace
entries: Each object of desire created by Aezidion's Desire

Revealed tries to embrace the target from whose imagination it was created, provided the target is within 20 feet of Aezidion. The target must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled}. Until the grapple ends (escape {@dc 25}), the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) bludgeoning damage at the end of each turn. If this damage drops a target to 0 or fewer hit points, the target dies, its body is absorbed by the daemon, and the object of desire disappears. A creature killed in this way cannot be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Aezidion makes one pseudopod attack.

legendary.name: Lure (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Aezidion targets one creature within range of its telepathy. The target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Charisma saving throw or Aezidion decides how the target moves during its next turn.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Aezidion casts a spell.

trait.name: Host Attached
entries: The amorine emerges from the host, where it remains until it or the host dies. The amorine moves with the host.

A creature that has the amorine {@condition grappled} can attempt to rip it from the host's body, contesting a Strength check against the amorine's Dexterity check. On a success, the amorine is pulled out of the host's body and it loses this trait. Upon losing this trait, the amorine's speed increases by 20 feet. On a successful save or a failed one , the host takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny worm. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or 10 ({@dice 1d10}
+ 5) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the eunuch can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The eunuch's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eunuch makes a gore attack and a tentacles attack. The eunuch can substitute a gut tendril attack in place of its gore attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage, and the eunuch makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with advantage until the end of its next turn. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grabbed (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The eunuch can grapple one creature at a time.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Gut Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature the eunuch has {@condition grappled}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target becomes infested by maggots. Constructs are immune to this effect. A target infested by maggots has its hit point maximum reduced by 7 ({@dice 2d6}) when it becomes infested and again at the start of each of its turns until the effect ends. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw and ends the effect on itself with a successful save. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until it finishes a long rest. A {@spell greater restoration} spell ends the infested by maggots effect and also ends the hit point maximum reduction on the target.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the eunuch patriarch can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the eunuch patriarch fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The eunuch patriarch's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eunuch patriarch makes a falchion attack, a gore attack, and a tentacles attack. The eunuch can substitute Awaken
Lust for its falchion attack and substitute a gut tendrils attack in place of its gore attack.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage, and the eunuch makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with advantage until the end of its next turn. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The eunuch can grapple one creature at a time.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Gut Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature the eunuch patriarch has {@condition grappled}. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage, and the target becomes infested by maggots.

Constructs are immune to this effect. A target infested by maggots has its hit point maximum reduced by 14 ({@dice 4d6}) when it becomes infested and again at the start of each of its turns until the effect ends. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw and ends the effect on itself with a successful save. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until it finishes a long rest. A {@spell greater restoration} spell ends the infested by maggots effect and also ends the hit point maximum reduction on the target.

action.name: Lust-Gnawing Trance
entries: The eunuch patriarch attempts to sap the animus—the "lust for life"—from one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect. The target creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the eunuch patriarch for 1 hour. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature's speed drops to 0 and it grants advantage to the eunuch patriarch's attack rolls made against it. At the end of each of the {@condition charmed} creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, but with disadvantage, ending the effect on itself with a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect becomes immune to this eunuch patriarch's Lust-Gnawing
Trance for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The eunuch patriarch moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The eunuch patriarch makes a falchion attack.

legendary.name: Disrobe (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The eunuch patriarch chooses one creature it has {@condition charmed}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or, consumed with discomfort take an action each round to doff any armor and clothing it is wearing until it is no longer clothed. If the target takes any damage, it can repeat the Charisma saving throw and ends the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Decadent Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. If the target is {@condition charmed} by the lustful, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) extra damage.

action.name: Enticing Invitation (1/Day)
entries: The lustful targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that can see it, forcing the target to make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by the lustful. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target experiences a whisper of the daemon's distorted psyche, and grants advantage on all attack rolls made by the lustful against it.

At the end of each of the affected creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to all lustfuls' Enticing Invitation for 24 hours.

trait.name: Daemonic Pheromones
entries: An ograq gives off a weird stink that stimulates perverse curiosity. When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of an ograq, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature's mind is overwhelmed with images of vivisection and gore, but feels entranced, rather than disgusted. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends it on itself becomes immune to all
Daemonic Pheromones for 24 hours. Constructs and undead are immune to Daemonic Pheromones.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ograq's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the ograq takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The ograq can grapple just one creature at a time.

action.name: Horrid Vivisection
entries: The ograq plunges its stiffened tentacles into the body of one creature {@condition grappled} by it. The creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the ograq gains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hit points.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The daemon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks).
The daemon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Inflame Passions
entries: At the start of each of the daemon's turns, each creature of its choice within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is overcome with a chaotic stream of emotions, which cause it to act unpredictably, as if under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell, for 1 minute. A creature confused in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this daemon's Inflame Passions trait for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spread the Plague
entries: Whenever a creature that isn't a construct or undead starts its turn within 60 feet of the daemon, the creature must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature ends the {@condition poisoned} effect on itself and becomes immune to this daemon's Spread the Plague for 24 hours.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The daemon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The daemon makes two bite attacks. It can cast a spell in place of one of these attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 8d6 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the daemon. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}; it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the daemon, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the daemon's turns.

If the daemon takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the daemon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all the creatures it has swallowed, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the daemon. If the daemon dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The unc doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny daemon. The swarm cannot regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Stingers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. In addition, a creature must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. If the poison damage drops the creature to 0 hit points, the creature automatically becomes stabilized and {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} hours. A {@spell lesser restoration} spell ends this effect on an affected creature. If the creature is {@condition paralyzed} the full time, the creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage and gives birth to a {@creature vlogar|bookoffiends}.
The vlogar stands up in the creature's space, rolls initiative, and typically attacks its host when it takes its turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The vlogar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The vlogar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Chameleon Hide
entries: The vlogar has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Insidious Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the vlogar can magically turn {@condition invisible}, along with anything it wears and carries, until its concentration ends.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Whispers of Lust {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the vlogar telepathically whispers to one creature within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects

Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I must find glory through lust." In addition, for 1 hour after becoming {@condition charmed}, whenever the target sees a creature to which it would ordinarily be sexually attracted, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by that creature until this effect ends. At the end of the target's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this vlogar's Whispers of Lust for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vlogar makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its bite. It can substitute a tongue attack for its bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and cannot speak.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abandoned dream's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). The abandoned dream can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The abandoned dream has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The abandoned dream's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Whispers of Sloth {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the abandoned dream telepathically whispers to one creature within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption

Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I do not take risks and am loathe to do anything." In addition, for 1 hour after becoming {@condition charmed}, the target's walking speed drops to 10 feet, if it's not already less than 10 feet, and the target makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this abandoned dream's Whispers of Sloth for 24 hours.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if the daemon isn't already grappling a creature.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage, and suffers Wisdom drain until it finishes a long rest. A target suffering Wisdom drain must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from every Wisdom attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes. Each time a target suffers Wisdom drain, the die it uses increases to the next higher size, such that a {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, and a {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}. If the die becomes a {@dice d20}, the target is afflicted with indefinite madness (see the Dungeon Master's Guide for details).

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The abandoned dream magically polymorphs into a

Large or smaller humanoid that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the daemon's choice).

In a new form, the abandoned dream retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but the abandoned dream lacks.

trait.name: Soporific Aura
entries: At the start of each of the indolent's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. If the creature is within 10 feet of two or more indolents, the creature makes the saving throw with disadvantage. A creature falls {@condition prone} and becomes {@condition unconscious} on a failed save, or becomes immune to all indolents' Soporific Auras for 24 hours on a successful one. An affected creature remains {@condition unconscious} until another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

trait.name: Lethargy
entries: When the indolent takes a turn, it can either move or take an action. The indolent cannot take reactions.

action.name: Exhausting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The languishing's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The languishing can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The languishing's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The languishing can grapple one target at a time.

action.name: Steal Head
entries: The languishing attempts to steal the head from one humanoid creature it has {@condition grappled}. The languishing contests a Strength check against the target's Strength check. On a success, the languishing pops the creature's head from its body and devours its jaw.

A target that loses its head in this way remains alive, but its body is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, though the target can still see and hear in regard to its head's position. Lacking a head prevents the target from speaking, which makes it impossible for the target to speak the verbal components of spells or command words for magic items it might possess. Furthermore, lacking orifices with which to eat or drink could result in the death of the body.

Whether or not the body dies, the head lives on in a state of continually deepening horror up to its normal life expectancy and without needing to eat or drink. A detached head has an AC 0 and 5 hit points. The head knows everything it knew before its separation, though its options, including those related to the lack of a jaw, are quite limited in this new divided state.
A detached head can be rejoined to the body by placing it on the neck stump and casting a {@spell heal} spell and a {@spell regenerate} spell on the target.
If the body or head dies, the divided creature cannot be restored to life and wholeness until both parts have died.

action.name: Lamenting Chorus {@recharge 5}
entries: The languishing's spider-leg-filled maw undulates in a frenzy, the gestures moving like a conductor overseeing a symphony. From the daemon's abdomen comes a wailing noise, the sound from all the damned souls it has swallowed. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the languishing that can hear the sound must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failed save, or just takes half the damage on a successful one.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Shogarr's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 26}). Shogarr can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Shogarr has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Shogarr's darkvision.

trait.name: Infernal Weapons
entries: Shogarr's weapon attacks are magical. When
Shogarr hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 10d8} fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Shogarr fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ruinous Aura
entries: At the start of each of Shogarr's turns, each creature hostile to Shogarr and within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 26} Charisma saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on this save becomes immune to Shogarr's Ruinous Aura for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Shogarr makes three attacks with his Harrowing

action.name: Blade
entries: Shogarr can cast a spell in place of one of these attacks.

action.name: Harrowing Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d20 + 10}) slashing damage plus 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be thrown {@dice 5d6} [ts] 10 feet and fall {@condition prone} at the end of this movement. If the thrown creature cannot move the full distance because it strikes an obstacle, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it didn't move.

reaction.name: Deafening Roar (Recharge 5-6)
entries: When Shogarr takes 20 damage or more from a single attack, he emits a thunderous roar that spreads out from a point inside his space to a 100-foot-radius sphere. Each creature hostile to Shogarr in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} forever on a failed save, or takes half the damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Shogarr makes an attack with his Harrowing Blade.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Shogarr moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Bellow (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Shogarr howls his hatred into a 120-foot- long cone originating from a point in his space. Each creature in the area that's hostile to him must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 4d12}) thunder damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slumbering valor's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The slumbering valor can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The daemon of slumbering valor can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.
It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Insidious Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the slumbering valor can magically turn {@condition invisible}, along with anything it wears and carries, until its concentration ends.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d8 + 2}) psychic damage.

action.name: Daemonic Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the daemon of slumbering valor can see within 5 feet of it and is {@condition charmed} by the daemon must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or become possessed by the daemon; the daemon then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. A second horrifying face appears on the back of the target's head. The daemon now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness.

The daemon can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma, and its damage resistances, damage immunities, condition immunities, and senses. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, gaining access to the target's knowledge, class features, and proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, at which point the body dies and the daemon and the target's soul disappear into Gehenna; the daemon ends it as a bonus action; or the daemon is forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends in any way other than the death of the target's body, the daemon reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this daemon's Daemonic Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Whispers of Sloth {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the slumbering valor telepathically whispers to one creature within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption

Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I have helped others enough. It's time I start looking after myself." In addition, for 1 hour after becoming {@condition charmed}, the target's walking speed drops to 10 feet, if it's not less than 10 feet already, and the target makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage.

At the end of the target's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this slumbering valor's Whispers of Sloth for 24 hours.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The thief of dreams can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Steal Dreams
entries: At the start of each of the thief of dreams' turns, if the thief of dreams is not {@condition incapacitated}, each {@condition unconscious} creature within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage. A creature that takes this damage can derive no benefit from finishing a short or long rest for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thief of dreams makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Deep Slumber {@recharge 5}
entries: The thief of dreams drains vitality from each creature of its choice within 60 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}, fall {@condition prone}, and become {@condition unconscious} until a creature uses an action to shake the target awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The umplebum makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Smothering Embrace
entries: The umplebum targets one Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it, attempting to enfold the creature in its smothering embrace. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Ability checks to escape the grapple are made with disadvantage. While the target is {@condition grappled}, it is also {@condition restrained}. At the start of each of the target's turns while it remains {@condition grappled} by the umplebum, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. An umplebum can grapple just one creature at a time.

action.name: Root
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:
The veezel attaches to the target. While attached, the veezel doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the veezel's turns, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

The veezel can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement, which it does once the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the veezel, provided it can find it.

action.name: Whispers of Sloth {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action, the veezel telepathically whispers to a creature to which it is attached, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in
Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I've done so much. I don't know why I should do anything more than relax." In addition, the target cannot use an action to remove the veezel.

At the end of the target's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this veezel's Whispers of Sloth for 24 hours.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the feasting can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The feasting's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Feast
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the feasting attaches to the target.
While attached, the feasting doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the feasting's turns, the target loses 5 ({@dice 1d4 + 3}) hit points due to its body being devoured.
The feasting can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement.
It does so after the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the feasting.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the flabule dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Then, a feasting swarm appears inside of the space the flabule occupied before it exploded. The feasting swarm rolls initiative and takes the next available turn.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The flabule's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Paralytic Aura
entries: At the start of each of the flabule's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it that is not a daemon must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute.

A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw or ends the effect on itself becomes immune to this flabule's Paralytic Aura for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flabule makes three attacks: one with its claws, one with its stinger, and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d12 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target becomes {@condition poisoned} until it finishes a long rest. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target suffers Dexterity drain. A creature suffering from Dexterity drain must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from every Dexterity attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes.

Each time the creature suffers Dexterity drain again, the die it rolls increases to the next higher size, such that a {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, and a {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}. If the die becomes a {@dice d20}, the target becomes {@condition unconscious} until it is no longer suffering from Dexterity drain. A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the drained creature ends the effect on it.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d6 + 1}) slashing damage, and a creature the same size as the flabule or smaller is pulled 5 feet toward the flabule.

action.name: Engorge
entries: If the flabule is Huge or smaller, it swallows one {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition unconscious} creature of its size or smaller that is within 5 feet of it. The flabule's size increases to the next higher category, and it gains 30 temporary hit points. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the flabule, and takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of the flabule's turns.

If the flabule takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the flabule must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the flabule.
If the flabule dies, a swallowed creature is no longer swallowed and lands {@condition prone} in a space occupied by the flabule.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the hunger can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The hunger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hunger's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Slave to Hunger
entries: When a creature within 5 feet drops to 0 hit points, the hunger must make a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the hunger must devour the creature until it takes damage, which ends this effect. It takes the hunger 1 round to devour a small creature. For Medium or larger creatures, it takes the hunger 2 rounds plus 2 rounds per size category above Medium. A creature devoured in this way dies and cannot be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunger makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the hungry can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the hungry takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage. If the creature drops to 0 or fewer hit points, the hungry gains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Hideous Growth
entries: At the start of each of its turns, if it is not {@condition incapacitated}, the krobulon bloats. The krobulon grants a bonus die to all creatures attacking it and also adds the roll of the bonus die to its own Strength attack rolls and damage rolls it makes with melee weapons. The die starts as a {@dice d8} and increases in size at the start of each subsequent turn, such that a {@dice d8} becomes a {@dice d10}, a {@dice d10} becomes a {@dice d12}, and so on.

If the bonus die is a {@dice d20} and would increase again, the krobulon releases a pulse of energy, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The bonus die then disappears and returns at the start of the krobulon's next turn as previously described.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Insidious Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the paesod can magically turn {@condition invisible}, along with anything it wears and carries, until its concentration ends.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The paesod's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Whispers of Gluttony {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the paesod telepathically whispers to one creature it can see that is within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I crave the exotic and forbidden, eager to sample all that I can consume." On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to this paesod's Whispers of Gluttony for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paesod makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the piercing damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The paesod fully devours the target if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to
The paesod defecates the remains of the creature it consumed 24 hours later, at which point the creature rises as a ghoul under the paesod's control.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is also {@condition incapacitated}.
A creature {@condition poisoned} by this effect can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Devour
entries: The wugart can take a bonus action to gobble up one {@condition unconscious} Medium or smaller creature that is not a construct and is within 10 feet of it. The creature dies, and its body remains inside the wugart for 24 hours or until the wugart takes the Excrement of Re-formation action.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wugart makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the wugart.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target suffers a ingering injury from the attack (see the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information).
If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured.

Every 24 hours that elapse, the {@condition poisoned} target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure. The disease is cured after three successes. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.
While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target gives off a horrid stench.

Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the target's stench for 24 hours.

Excrement of Re-formation. The wugart expels from its nether regions one dead creature it has devoured into an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The creature returns to life with 1 hit point. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or gain a random long-term madness (see the Dungeon Master's Guide to learn more).

action.name: Disgorge Feasting (1/Day)
entries: The wugart cannot digest its meals without the aid of the feastings crawling around inside its gullet.

The wugart can vomit a feasting swarm (see Feasting Swarm, earlier in this chapter, for more information) into a space within 10 feet of it. The feasting swarm is friendly to the wugart. It immediately rolls initiative and takes the next available turn to attack the wugart's enemies. If there are no enemies to attack, the feasting swarm takes the Dash action and moves toward the wugart's space on each of its turns until it enters the wugart's space, at which point the swarm reenters the wugart's body.

reaction.name: Snapping Jaws
entries: When a creature moves to within 10 feet of the wugart, the wugart can make a bite attack against the triggering creature.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When Zovarik dies, he explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of him must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The slime thrown from his body deals maximum damage to objects in the area that are not made from metal or stone.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Zovarik fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Slime Trail
entries: Foul, glistening slime spills from Zovarik's nether regions. Whenever Zovarik moves, the slime splashes onto the ground in the space he left. The slime remains until the start of
Zovarik's next turn. The slime is corrosive to everything except stone or metal, dealing {@damage 2d10} acid damage to anything not made from these materials that comes into contact with it.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Zovarik gives off a horrid stench. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Zovarik must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to
Zovarik's stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zovarik makes four attacks: two with his tentacle and two with his bite.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward Zovarik.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If Zovarik scores a critical hit, he rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Disgorge Feasting (2/Day)
entries: Zovarik cannot digest his meals without the aid of the feastings crawling around inside his gullet. Zovarik can vomit a feasting swarm (see Feasting Swarm, earlier in this chapter, for more information) into a space within 15 feet of him. The feasting swarm is friendly to Zovarik. It immediately rolls initiative and takes the next available turn to attack Zovarik's enemies. If there are no enemies to attack, the feasting swarm takes the Dash action and moves toward Zovarik's space on each of its turns until it enters
Zovarik's space, at which point the swarm reenters his body.

reaction.name: Snapping Maw
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of Zovarik moves or a creature moves to within 5 feet of Zovarik, Zovarik makes a bite attack against that creature.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Zovarik makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Zovarik moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Corrosive Defecation (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Zovarik forcibly sprays corrosive slime into a 30-foot cone originating from his anus. The slime deals 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage to anything in the area that is not made from metal or stone. A creature in the area can make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw and takes half the damage on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The furtivin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}). The furtivin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Daemonic Swiftness
entries: If the furtivin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, the furtivin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the furtivin can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the furtivin deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the furtivin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the furtivin doesn't have disadvantage on the roll.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Fetch
entries: When a creature the furtivin can see within 30 feet of it withdraws or stows an item from a container, draws or sheathes a weapon, or drops or picks up something, and the furtivin has at least one hand free, the furtivin can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the item magically teleports to the furtivin's hand.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hoarder's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoarder makes one slam attack and four tentacles attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The hoarder has four tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Enervating Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the hoarder can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or become possessed by the daemon; the hoarder then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The daemon now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The daemon can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence,

action.name: Wisdom, and Charisma
entries: It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}). The reduction lasts until the creature is no longer possessed and finishes a long rest. If the reduction drops the creature's hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies and disappears, along with the daemon, into Gehenna.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the daemon ends it as a bonus action, or the daemon is somehow forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the hoarder reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this daemon's
Enervating Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the jageth hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Defensive Stance
entries: As a bonus action, the jageth can drop into a defensive stance and remain in that stance until it moves. Until the effect ends, the jageth imposes disadvantage on attack rolls made against it and makes all saving throws with advantage. While in this stance the jageth ignores any effect that would knock it {@condition prone} or force it to move.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The jageth's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jageth makes one slam attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The jageth has two arms, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Body Block
entries: The jageth adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit. To do so, the jageth must see the attacker and have at least one creature {@condition grappled}. If the attack results in a miss, the attack instead hits the creature the jageth has {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Insidious Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the maodon can magically turn {@condition invisible}, along with anything it wears and carries, until its concentration ends.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The maodon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the maodon knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The maodon ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Whispers of Greed {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the maodon telepathically whispers to one creature it can see that is within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I hoard my possessions and never share with others anything that's mine." On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to this maodon's Whispers of Greed for 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Theft
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:
The maodon steals one item the target is wearing or carrying but not holding in its hand, provided the maodon can hold the item in one hand and has at least one hand free.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 11} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, hp 5, vulnerability to fire damage, immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The miser can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the miser deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the miser that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the miser doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature and carrying or wearing an item that the miser can hold in one hand, the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or the miser takes an object that it can hold in one hand from the target.

trait.name: Fiery Body
entries: A creature that touches the mockery or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fiery Weapons
entries: When the mockery hits with a melee attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The mockery in flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mocking Laughter {@recharge 5}
entries: The mockery in flame can take a bonus action to erupt in mad, chilling laughter. Each creature within 60 feet of the daemon that can hear the laughter must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw to resist the effect or end it is immune to this daemon's mocking laughter for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mockery in flame makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A creature killed in this way has its soul devoured and cannot be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The remnant can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: A remnant's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Maddening Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. A creature becomes afflicted with a short-term madness on a failed saving throw, or becomes immune to the madness effect for 24 hours on a successful one.

action.name: Daemonic Possession
entries: One Large or Medium humanoid that the remnant can see within 5 feet of it makes a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the remnant disappears and the target is possessed by the remnant. The possessed creature retains control over its body, but it makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage until the possession ends. While possessing the target, the remnant can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the remnant ends it as a bonus action, or the remnant is forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the remnant reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this remnant's possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Whenever a possessed target finishes a short or long rest, it must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, with a-2 penalty to the roll for each remnant inside its body beyond the first. On a failed save, the target loses control of its body for {@dice 1d6} hours, during which time the target becomes {@condition incapacitated}. The remnant controls the target's body, using the body's statistics but retaining its own alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. If the target succeeds on this saving throw, one remnant possessing it leaves the target's body as described previously.

trait.name: Acrid Smoke (1/Day)
entries: When the spawn takes damage, smoke pours from all of its orifices for 1 minute. The smoke moves with the spawn, remaining in its space and causing the spawn to become partially obscured, and imposes disadvantage on attack rolls made against it. A strong wind disperses the smoke until the end of the spawn's next turn.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The spawn of Draqolath has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn makes a gore attack and a bite attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Oberius)
headerEntries: Oberius's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Oberius can innately cast the following spells, requiring no somatic or material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The taker makes four attacks: one with its miser's bite, two with its arm blades, and one with its tongue. The taker can cast an innate spell in place of its miser's bite attack and hurl lightning in place of one of its arm blade attacks.

action.name: Miser's Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or become charmedor 1 minute. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

action.name: Arm Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it becomes {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Hurl Lightning
entries: The taker targets one creature it can see within 400 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) lightning damage. A creature that takes this damage must also succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The taker adds +5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the taker must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The taker magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Killing Field (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The taker releases a pulse of magical daemonic energy. Each creature of its choice in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage and 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Enervating Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The taker targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and reduce its hit point maximum by 27 ({@dice 6d8}) until magic, such as the {@spell greater restoration} spell, ends the reduction.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The enticer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Insidious Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the enticer can magically turn {@condition invisible}, along with anything it wears and carries, until its concentration ends.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The enticer's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spawn Evil Twin
entries: If the enticer starts its turn inside the body of a creature it has possessed and that creature has 3 corruption or more, the enticer can take a bonus action to spawn an evil twin. The target host's corruption drops to 0 and then the host falls {@condition prone} and becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn, as its body divides to create an evil twin of the original creature.

T he evil twin has all the memories and knowledge of its duplicate and uses all of its duplicate's statistics except for alignment, which is neutral evil. The evil twin also has nonmagical copies of anything the original creature was wearing and carrying. The evil twin immediately stands up in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the original creature and moves up to its speed. It then rolls initiative and takes the next available turn. The evil twin is hostile to the original creature and works to destroy its life.

trait.name: Whispers of Pride {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the enticer telepathically whispers to one creature within 5 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes possessed by the enticer; the enticer then disappears. While possessing a creature, the enticer can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. While possessed, the target can act freely and, once per round, make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage. Each time the target makes a roll with advantage granted by the daemon, the target gains 1 corruption.

The possession lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the enticer ends it as a bonus action, or the enticer is forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the enticer reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this enticer's Whispers of Pride for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Arcane Spellcasting
headerEntries: One of the faces is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). The face of the great has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Divine Spellcasting
headerEntries: One of the faces of the great is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The face of the great has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the faces of the great fail a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The faces of the great's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The faces of the great can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The faces of the great have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Three Personalities
entries: The faces of the great have three distinct minds and personalities individuated as follows: arcane, divine, and warrior. The faces of the great can use up to three actions on its turn (see Undisciplined Minds). The arcane mind can take an action to cast a spell from its arcane spellcasting or attack with its slam. The divine mind can cast a spell from its divine spellcasting or attack with its slam. And the warrior can use multiattack.

trait.name: Undisciplined Minds
entries: At the start of each of the faces of the great's turns, roll a {@dice d10} and consult the following table to see what the faces of the great do. Some results allow one or more random faces to take turns. If this happens, roll a {@dice d6} to determine which face can act or cannot act: 1-2, arcane; 3-4, divine; 5-6, warrior.

1-3 The faces of the great spend their turn arguing and bickering with one another. They cannot take actions or reactions until the start of their next turn. 4 Two faces spend their turn pouting and doing nothing. A randomly determined face can use one action. 5 One face spends its turn pouting and doing nothing. Determine which face sits out this turn. The other two faces can each use an action.
6-10 All three faces can use actions during this turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The faces of the great make three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The faces of the great cast a cantrip.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The faces of the great move up to their speed.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The faces of the great make a slam attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glomeray's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). The glomeray can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Whispers of Pride {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the glomeray telepathically whispers to one creature it can see within 120 feet of it, forcing the creature to make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw.
On a failed save, the target gains 1 corruption (see the Corruption

Effects Table in Chapter 3 for more information) and becomes {@condition charmed} for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target gains a new flaw: "I am the greatest, and everyone should know it." In addition, for 1 minute after becoming {@condition charmed}, the target makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage while within 5 feet of another creature. Each time the target finishes a short rest or a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself with a success. The target becomes immune to this glomeray's Whispers of Pride for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or the effect ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The glomeray makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The kurgel's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The kurgel can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Accelerated (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the kurgel can accelerate itself for 1 minute. When it does so, it rolls initiative and can take an additional turn during the round on this initiative count.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the kurgel is subject to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The kurgel's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Excessive Pride
